result.execSummary:
The defendant Vitana Nmi Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm [Modifiers: PTAC], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: PTAC], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:09 AM Defendant Vitana Nmi Lopez in court.  Amanda E. Keitel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Wendy Buss in court on behalf of Department of Corrections.
DOC indicates that defendant's probation time is up but there is and outstanding restitution balance. Court questions how many defendants were ordered to pay restitution. Ms. Buss states that two co-defendants were ordered to pay restitution with defendant joint & several. Restitution balance is $35,396.37 and all three defendants have been paying. The amount owed is to insurance companies and Crime Victim Compensation Fund.
Court questions defendant.
Attorney Keitel is requesting that probation period be extended.
Court extends probation for one year. If payments continue, Court will not extend probation after one year.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Vitana Nmi Lopez in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond is continued.
State
Jury status hearing at 02-09-2016 03:30 pm
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-22-2016 09:00 am

11:07 a.m.  Defendant Vitana Nmi Lopez not in court.  Attorney Zenor appears.    Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Grode states he has received a letter from Dr. Sampson on the case.  Atty. Zenor enters Exhibit 1, a new letter from Dr. Sampson.  Court questions Atty. Zenor regarding the birth and Atty. Zenor states it was not a C-Section.  Atty. Zenor renews her request for adjournment and argues for her motion.    Court questions Atty. Zenor regarding what contact she has had with the defendant before and after her giving birth.  Court questions the contact they have had and effort made to talk regarding the offer made 8/12/15. 11:22 a.m. Defendant Gabriel Nmi Lopez in court with attorney Gary R Schmaus.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Schmaus addresses his motion with the Court regarding discovery.  Court questions if he has received all the DVD's and Atty. Schmaus isn't sure.  Atty. Schmaus has 7 DVD's in his possession.    Exhibit 2 is marked, DVD listing.  Atty. Schmause joins in the request for adjournment requested by Atty. Zenor.   Atty. Zenor has 10 discs, isn't sure if she has received them all.  Atty. Zenor rechecked and she has 11 discs. Defendant Jesus A Guajardo-Tova in court with attorney Michael Hughes.  Atty. Hughes joins in the request for adjournment.  Requests that all attorney meet and review discover. Defendant Miguel A Lopez in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Atty. Sheets joins in the request for adjournment and for all the defendants and cases.  Atty. Sheets believes he has all the discover in this matter, but wishes State to let them know how many discs there are.  Defendant Yasmin Y Lopez in court with attorney D. Nicholas Carroll  Atty. Carroll agrees to the statements made by Atty. Sheet and requests adjournment for all the parties.  Atty. Carroll believes he has received all discovery.  11:39 a.m. State addresses the issues in Court.  Atty. Grode argues against adjournment.  State is prepared to revoke the offer if that will move the case forward.  State address the new witness being added from Atty. Schmaus and objects.  State addresses discovery.  State wishes to proceed to trial.  Court questions Atty. Grode regarding the offers made to the different parties.  Atty. Grode states that the victims are ready to proceed but do not wish to address the Court.  Court denies Atty. Schmaus's motion to dismiss regarding discovery.  Court grants the adjournment to every defendant and states reasoning.  Jury rescheduled for Feb.22 thru March 4th,  2016  Court questions whether there is any other situations that would become a problem.  No problems stated from any other parties.

Attorney Grode makes statement and feels that some of the photos can be cropped to just show the injuries.
Court orders that 0520 and 0524 picture will be excluded. 0521 will be allowed. 0522, 0523 will be allow but cropped if possible to not include IV's and wristbands.
Attorney Zenor makes motion to adjourn jury trial.
Attorney Carroll has no comment.
Attorney Schmaus has no comment other than he does not wish the cases to be severed.
Attorney Grode states that victim's rights have been complied with. State is opposed to trial being rescheduled.
Court denies motion to adjourn trial. May revisit motion as it gets closer to trial date.

Attorney Sheets's Motions in Limine are discussed and all are granted. Attorney Sheets amends motion #4 is conform to what was earlier ruled by the Court.

10:05 Defendant Vitana Nmi Lopez in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses scheduling order.
Attorney Slattery has filed motion to withdraw from defendant's case, 14CF261. Attorney Slattery makes statement and asks Court allow him to withdraw. Court questions defendant and co-defendant's counsel. Court grants motion to withdraw.
Court questions co-defendants regarding their relationship with their attorney. All state they are happy with their counsel and intend to keep them.
Court feels that motions should all be heard at later date when new counsel is appointed for defendant Guajardo-Tova and trial date will need to be adjourned. Court questions counsel and they all agree with this.
Court orders that trial date be rescheduled and motions will be held at later date.

in Limine
cover letter from Attorney Zenor for Motions in Limine
SCHEDULING ORDER
Scheduling conference on October 27, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Vitana Nmi Lopez in court with attorney Sandra J. Zenor.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Zenor presents her motion to dismiss Counts 1 and 4.  Atty Lambert argues that Atty Zenor's motion has little merit and should be denied.  Atty Zenor presents rebuttal argument.  Court states findings and denies the motion to dismiss count 1 and 4.  

Atty Lambert moves the court for Joinder.   Atty Slattery presents argument that there is information that has not been handed over at this time.  Court suggests that if it is Joined and information is received later that counsel could always file for Severance at that time.  Atty Sheets presents argument regarding potential Brutan issues.  Atty Zenor presents argument regarding Brutan issues.  Atty Carroll states he is in agreement with other attys present and is also concerned with potential Brutan issues.   Atty Schmaus agrees with other attys and presents argument.  Atty Lambert informs court that further reports are expected.  Will look into witness that wish to remain confidential.  Atty Lambert presents rebuttal argument asking that the 5 be tried and joined together.  Atty Slattery addresses joinder issue.  Atty Sheets addresses joinder issue.  Atty Zenor argues the joinder issue.  Atty Carroll agrees with counsel and argues the joinder issue.  Atty Schmaus echoes statements of Atty Carroll and Atty Zenor.  Atty Lambert rebuts.  Court states findings and grants the motion to join.  

Atty Lambert presents motion for admission of other acts evidence.  Atty Slattery does not believe his client is implicated one way or the other.  Atty Sheets believes his client is not implicated.  Atty Zenor presents argument against the motion.  Atty Carroll presents argument.  Atty Schmaus presents argument.  Atty Lambert has nothing further.  Court states findings and denies the motion for the full incident except for limited element regarding the altercation the night before only.  

Atty Slattery questions the timing of scheduling trial.  Atty Sheets thinks it should be set for at least 1 week.  Counsel would like it to be set for a scheduling conference.  Court asks counsel to set with Judicial Assistant.

2:53 Defendant Vitana Nmi Lopez in court with attorney Sandra J Zenor.  Kelly A Lehn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Joseph Zurfluh is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lehn. He is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. On 5/25/14, he was dispatched to Highway 73 South in the Town of Saratoga, Wood County, Wisconsin, regarding a physical altercation. Several individuals were beating a car with a baseball bat and there were injuries. He states EMT and Nekoosa Police Department officers were on scene. A vehicle was damaged. There was a male and female injured at that location. Witnesses states that a silver van pulled up with 8-10 individuals inside armed with sticks or baseball bats and confronted them regarding an incident that happened the night before near Red Granite. They were told to leave the residence. Two individuals were assaulted with the sticks or baseball bats. He testifies as to his observations of their injuries. He identified some of the individuals. He identifies the individuals in the courtroom. The damaged vehicle was owned by one of the victims. No one gave defendants to damage the vehicle or strike victims. 
Attorney Carroll cross-examines witness. 
Attorney Zenor cross-examines witness. 
Attorney Lehn makes statement.
Attorney Carroll makes statement.
Attorney Lehn makes statement.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Bound over for further proceedings. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 10:00 am.
